intro: Aloysia scorodonioides var. scorodonioides, commonly known as lemon verbena, is a flowering shrub native to South America. It is characterized by its fragrant, lemon-scented leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with serrated edges and a glossy surface. Lemon verbena is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of aromatic essential oils.
